ratings.comment: I LOVED Mateo. He made even the most boring topics interesting, and his passion and humor shine through in his lectures. Classes mostly consisted of discussion, and he would even give us time to draft our writings and do peer review. Grades based on 3 short papers, class participation, and weekly HW assignments. Try to get him for 311 if you can!

Mateo is the best. Spanish in college was harder then I thought, but he made the difference. I genuinely enjoyed being in class everyday. He cares about his students a lot, in a personal sense, and academically. He makes time for you, is very kind and patient, and a fantastic teacher. Easily the best class experience I have had in college so far.

Goes over concepts in detail and prepares the class well for the exam. His passion for teaching really makes the class engaging and interesting, connects the material to relevant experiences and activities which makes the lectures fun. Would highly recommend his class.

You can tell he really cares about his students and how they are doing in class, he is definitely funny, participation matters as it is grading, but that is because he just wants you to do well in class. Lots of deadlines and do dates and busy work, but it all pays off in the end for quizzes every two week and about 3 different exams.

Mateo actually really cared whether or not we learned the material and how we did on tests. I enjoyed his humor and how he interacted with students. The class itself has a quite a bit of work to stay caught up with, but Mateo makes it pretty manageable. Wish I could take him for my next semester of Spanish.

Mateo is a good teacher and a good person. His background in linguistics helps him teach from unique angles. He helped me with every struggle I had in Spanish 101. He always explained grammar in a couple ways so everyone could grasp it. And he made learning Spanish fun - not an easy task. There was a positive social element in class because of him

Mateo was one of the greatest teachers Ive ever had, he was so down to earth and I got along with him on a personal level. He cared very much about me improving and always came ready to teach us to the best of his ability. Very knowledgeable in Spanish of multiple dialects and a genius in linguistics. Would definitely recommend to everyone!

Spanish 102 was the hardest spanish class I have ever taken; language classes here are no joke. Exams were hard, but they're through the deparment, not the teacher. Mateo took so much time out of his day to help us and always put his students first; he would personally email me study tips. funny, genuine If you put in effort, he will reciprocate.

Mateo, as he likes to be called is an excellent professor. He is knowledgeable about the material, but he also cares about the students. If you can take him, definitely do. My only complaint about the class was about the curriculum, not the professor. I definitely recommend him.
